About Yasca

Yasca is a multi-platform static analysis tool designed to help developers create high-quality, secure software. More information can be found at yasca.org.

Yasca Version: 3.0.5

The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/admin\/betweendates-detailsreports.php","lineNumber":79,"message":"$sql=mysqli_query($con,\"select * Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/admin\/doctor-specilization.php","lineNumber":12,"message":"$sql=mysqli_query($con,\"insert into doctorSpecilization(specilization) values('$doctorspecilization')\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"2":"error_reporting(0);","3":"include('include\/config.php');","4":"if(strlen($_SESSION['id']==0)) {","5":" header('location:logout.php');","6":" } else{","7":"","8":"if(isset($_POST['submit']))","9":"{","10":"$doctorspecilization=$_POST['doctorspecilization'];","11":"$sql=mysqli_query($con,\"insert into doctorSpecilization(specilization) values('$doctorspecilization')\");","12":"$_SESSION['msg']=\"Doctor Specialization added successfully !!\";","13":"}","14":"\/\/Code Deletion","15":"if(isset($_GET['del']))","16":"{","17":"$sid=$_GET['id'];\t","18":"mysqli_query($con,\"delete from doctorSpecilization where id = '$sid'\");","19":"$_SESSION['msg']=\"data deleted !!\";","20":"}","21":"?>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/admin\/index.php","lineNumber":10,"message":"$ret=mysqli_query($con,\"SELECT * FROM admin WHERE username='$uname' and password='$upassword'\");","unsafeSourceCode":["<?php","session_start();","error_reporting(0);","include(\"include\/config.php\");","if(isset($_POST['submit']))","{","$uname=$_POST['username'];","$upassword=$_POST['password'];","","$ret=mysqli_query($con,\"SELECT * FROM admin WHERE username='$uname' and password='$upassword'\");","$num=mysqli_fetch_array($ret);","if($num>0)","{","$_SESSION['login']=$_POST['username'];","$_SESSION['id']=$num['id'];","header(\"location:dashboard.php\");","","}","else","{"]},{"severity":1,"category":"Cross Site Scripting","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Cross_Site_Scripting":"OWASP: XSS Vulnerability","https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/XSS":"OWASP: XSS Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the sink.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/admin\/index.php","lineNumber":64,"message":"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<span style=\"color:red;\"><?php echo htmlentities($_SESSION['errmsg']); The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/admin\/manage-users.php","lineNumber":12,"message":"\t\t mysqli_query($con,\"delete from users where id ='$uid'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"2":"error_reporting(0);","3":"include('include\/config.php');","4":"if(strlen($_SESSION['id']==0)) {","5":" header('location:logout.php');","6":" } else{","7":"","8":"if(isset($_GET['del']))","9":"\t\t {","10":"\t\t \t$uid=$_GET['id'];","11":"\t\t mysqli_query($con,\"delete from users where id ='$uid'\");","12":" $_SESSION['msg']=\"data deleted !!\";","13":"\t\t }","14":"?>","15":"<!DOCTYPE html>","16":"<html lang=\"en\">","17":"\t<head>","18":"\t\t<title>Admin | Manage Users<\/title>","19":"\t\t","20":"\t\t<link href=\"http:\/\/fonts.googleapis.com\/css?family=Lato:300,400,400italic,600,700|Raleway:300,400,500,600,700|Crete+Round:400italic\" rel=\"stylesheet\" type=\"text\/css\" \/>","21":"\t\t<link rel=\"stylesheet\" href=\"vendor\/bootstrap\/css\/bootstrap.min.css\">"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the !important}",""]},{"severity":1,"category":"Weak Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least 128-bits of entropy).","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Codereview-Authentication#Weak_Passwords_and_Password_Functionality":"OWASP: Weak Passwords","http:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/259.html":"CWE-259: Hard-Coded Password"},"filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/admin\/vendor\/ckeditor\/skins\/bootstrapck\/editor_ie7.css","lineNumber":1,"message":".cke_reset{margin:0;padding:0;border:0;background:0;text-decoration:none;width:auto;height:auto;vertical-align:baseline;box-sizing:content-box;-moz-box-sizing:content-box;-webkit-box-sizing:content-box;position:static;-webkit-transition:none;-moz-transition:none;-ms-transition:none;transition:none}.cke_reset_all,.cke_reset_all The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/admin\/view-patient.php","lineNumber":82,"message":" $ret=mysqli_query($con,\"select * from tblpatient where ID='$vid'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"72":"<\/ol>","73":"<\/div>","74":"<\/section>","75":"<div class=\"container-fluid container-fullw bg-white\">","76":"<div class=\"row\">","77":"<div class=\"col-md-12\">","78":"<h5 class=\"over-title margin-bottom-15\">Manage <span class=\"text-bold\">Patients<\/span><\/h5>","79":"<?php","80":" $vid=$_GET['viewid'];","81":" $ret=mysqli_query($con,\"select * from tblpatient where ID='$vid'\");","82":"$cnt=1;","83":"while ($row=mysqli_fetch_array($ret)) {","84":" ?>","85":"<table border=\"1\" class=\"table table-bordered\">","86":" <tr align=\"center\">","87":"<td colspan=\"4\" style=\"font-size:20px;color:blue\">","88":" Patient Details<\/td><\/tr>","89":"","90":" <tr>","91":" <th scope>Patient Name<\/th>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/admin\/view-patient.php","lineNumber":121,"message":"$ret=mysqli_query($con,\"select * from tblmedicalhistory where PatientID='$vid'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"111":" <td><?php echo $row['PatientMedhis'];?><\/td>","112":" <th>Patient Reg Date<\/th>","113":" <td><?php echo $row['CreationDate'];?><\/td>","114":" <\/tr>","115":" ","116":"<?php }?>","117":"<\/table>","118":"<?php ","119":"","120":"$ret=mysqli_query($con,\"select * from tblmedicalhistory where PatientID='$vid'\");","121":"","122":"","123":"","124":" ?>","125":"<table id=\"datatable\" class=\"table table-bordered dt-responsive nowrap\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse; Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the sink.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/appointment-history.php","lineNumber":95,"message":"\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t<td><?php echo Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/book-appointment.php","lineNumber":18,"message":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"insert into appointment(doctorSpecialization,doctorId,userId,consultancyFees,appointmentDate,appointmentTime,userStatus,doctorStatus) values('$specilization','$doctorid','$userid','$fees','$appdate','$time','$userstatus','$docstatus')\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"8":"{","9":"$specilization=$_POST['Doctorspecialization'];","10":"$doctorid=$_POST['doctor'];","11":"$userid=$_SESSION['id'];","12":"$fees=$_POST['fees'];","13":"$appdate=$_POST['appdate'];","14":"$time=$_POST['apptime'];","15":"$userstatus=1;","16":"$docstatus=1;","17":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"insert into appointment(doctorSpecialization,doctorId,userId,consultancyFees,appointmentDate,appointmentTime,userStatus,doctorStatus) values('$specilization','$doctorid','$userid','$fees','$appdate','$time','$userstatus','$docstatus')\");","18":"\tif($query)","19":"\t{","20":"\t\techo \"<script>alert('Your appointment successfully booked');<\/script>\";","21":"\t}","22":"","23":"}","24":"?>","25":"<!DOCTYPE html>","26":"<html lang=\"en\">","27":"\t<head>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least 128-bits of entropy).","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Codereview-Authentication#Weak_Passwords_and_Password_Functionality":"OWASP: Weak Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/change-password.php","lineNumber":11,"message":"$sql=mysqli_query($con,\"SELECT password FROM users where password='\".md5($_POST['cpass']).\"' && id='\".$_SESSION['id'].\"'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"1":"session_start();","2":"\/\/error_reporting(0);","3":"include('include\/config.php');","4":"include('include\/checklogin.php');","5":"check_login();","6":"date_default_timezone_set('Asia\/Kolkata');\/\/ change according timezone","7":"$currentTime = date( 'd-m-Y h:i:s A', time () );","8":"if(isset($_POST['submit']))","9":"{","10":"$sql=mysqli_query($con,\"SELECT password FROM users where password='\".md5($_POST['cpass']).\"' && id='\".$_SESSION['id'].\"'\");","11":"$num=mysqli_fetch_array($sql);","12":"if($num>0)","13":"{","14":" $con=mysqli_query($con,\"update users set password='\".md5($_POST['npass']).\"', updationDate='$currentTime' where id='\".$_SESSION['id'].\"'\");","15":"$_SESSION['msg1']=\"Password Changed Successfully !!\";","16":"}","17":"else","18":"{","19":"$_SESSION['msg1']=\"Old Password not match !!\";","20":"}"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least 128-bits of entropy).","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Codereview-Authentication#Weak_Passwords_and_Password_Functionality":"OWASP: Weak Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/doctor\/edit-patient.php","lineNumber":19,"message":"$sql=mysqli_query($con,\"update tblpatient set PatientName='$patname',PatientContno='$patcontact',PatientEmail='$patemail',PatientGender='$gender',PatientAdd='$pataddress',PatientAge='$patage',PatientMedhis='$medhis' where ID='$eid'\");","unsafeSourceCode":{"9":"{\t","10":"\t$eid=$_GET['editid'];","11":"\t$patname=$_POST['patname'];","12":"$patcontact=$_POST['patcontact'];","13":"$patemail=$_POST['patemail'];","14":"$gender=$_POST['gender'];","15":"$pataddress=$_POST['pataddress'];","16":"$patage=$_POST['patage'];","17":"$medhis=$_POST['medhis'];","18":"$sql=mysqli_query($con,\"update tblpatient set PatientName='$patname',PatientContno='$patcontact',PatientEmail='$patemail',PatientGender='$gender',PatientAdd='$pataddress',PatientAge='$patage',PatientMedhis='$medhis' where ID='$eid'\");","19":"if($sql)","20":"{","21":"echo \"<script>alert('Patient info updated Successfully');<\/script>\";","22":"header('location:manage-patient.php');","23":"","24":"}","25":"}","26":"?>","27":"<!DOCTYPE html>","28":"<html lang=\"en\">"}},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least 128-bits of entropy).","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Codereview-Authentication#Weak_Passwords_and_Password_Functionality":"OWASP: Weak Passwords","http:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/259.html":"CWE-259: Hard-Coded Password"},"filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/doctor\/index.php","lineNumber":9,"message":"$ret=mysqli_query($con,\"SELECT * FROM doctors WHERE docEmail='$uname' and VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/doctor\/index.php","lineNumber":9,"message":"$ret=mysqli_query($con,\"SELECT * FROM doctors WHERE docEmail='$uname' and password='$dpassword'\");","unsafeSourceCode":["<?php","session_start();","include(\"include\/config.php\");","error_reporting(0);","if(isset($_POST['submit']))","{","$uname=$_POST['username'];","$dpassword=md5($_POST['password']);\t","$ret=mysqli_query($con,\"SELECT * FROM doctors WHERE docEmail='$uname' and password='$dpassword'\");","$num=mysqli_fetch_array($ret);","if($num>0)","{","$_SESSION['dlogin']=$_POST['username'];","$_SESSION['id']=$num['id'];","$uid=$num['id'];","$uip=$_SERVER['REMOTE_ADDR'];","$status=1;","\/\/Code Logs","$log=mysqli_query($con,\"insert into doctorslog(uid,username,userip,status) values('$uid','$uname','$uip','$status')\");",""]},{"severity":1,"category":"SQL Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. !important}",""]},{"severity":1,"category":"Weak Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least 128-bits of entropy).","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Codereview-Authentication#Weak_Passwords_and_Password_Functionality":"OWASP: Weak this.optional(b)||\/^\\d+$\/.test(a)},creditcard:function(a,b){if(this.optional(b))return\"dependency-mismatch\";if(\/[^0-9 \\-]+\/.test(a))return!1;var e%10===0},minlength:function(b,c,d){var e=a.isArray(b)?b.length:this.getLength(b,c);return this.optional(c)||e>=d},maxlength:function(b,c,d){var e=a.isArray(b)?b.length:this.getLength(b,c);return The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the Injection","pluginName":"BuiltIn","references":{"https:\/\/www.fortify.com\/vulncat\/en\/vulncat\/java\/sql_injection.html":"Fortify: VulnCat SQL Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. SQL injection\r\nattacks are also known as SQL insertion attacks.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/forgot-password.php","lineNumber":9,"message":"$query=mysqli_query($con,\"select id from users where fullName='$name' and email='$email'\");","unsafeSourceCode":["<?php","session_start();","error_reporting(0);","include(\"include\/config.php\");","\/\/Checking Details for reset password","if(isset($_POST['submit'])){","$name=$_POST['fullname'];","$email=$_POST['email'];","$query=mysqli_query($con,\"select id from users where fullName='$name' and email='$email'\");","$row=mysqli_num_rows($query);","if($row>0){","","$_SESSION['name']=$name;","$_SESSION['email']=$email;","header('location:reset-password.php');","} else {","echo \"<script>alert('Invalid details. Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the sink.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/vendor\/ckeditor\/samples\/assets\/posteddata.php","lineNumber":42,"message":"\t\t\t<td><pre class=\"samples\"><?php echo $value; ?><\/pre><\/td>","unsafeSourceCode":{"32":"\t\t\tcontinue;","33":"","34":"\t\tif ( get_magic_quotes_gpc() )","35":"\t\t\t$value = htmlspecialchars( stripslashes((string)$value) );","36":"\t\telse","37":"\t\t\t$value = htmlspecialchars( (string)$value );","38":"?>","39":"\t\t<tr>","40":"\t\t\t<th style=\"vertical-align: top\"><?php echo htmlspecialchars( (string)$key ); id=\"footer\">","49":"\t\t<hr>","50":"\t\t<p>","51":"\t\t\tCKEditor - The text editor for the Internet - <a class=\"samples\" href=\"http:\/\/ckeditor.com\/\">http:\/\/ckeditor.com<\/a>"}},{"severity":1,"category":"Weak Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least 128-bits of entropy).","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Codereview-Authentication#Weak_Passwords_and_Password_Functionality":"OWASP: Weak !important}",""]},{"severity":1,"category":"Weak Credentials","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"It is important to use strong passwords that are difficult to guess.\r\nThis finding indicates that a password was chosen that falls into\r\none of the following categories:\r\n\r\n* Repeated String (i.e. foo2foo)\r\n* Password Matching UserID\r\n* Blank UserID\/Password\r\n* Password Ending in \"4ever\"\r\n* Seasonal Password (i.e. summer12)\r\n* Common Password (based on reported \"most common\" passwords)\r\n\r\nIf these passwords are required to remain hard-coded, they should be changed to something\r\nstronger (at least 128-bits of entropy).","references":{"https:\/\/www.owasp.org\/index.php\/Codereview-Authentication#Weak_Passwords_and_Password_Functionality":"OWASP: Weak Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA solution to this problem would be HtmlEncoding at the sink.","filename":"\/hospital\/hms\/vendor\/jquery-file-upload\/server\/php\/UploadHandler.php","lineNumber":152,"message":" 'print_response' => true","unsafeSourceCode":{"142":" \/\/'upload_dir' => dirname($this->get_server_var('SCRIPT_FILENAME')).'\/thumb\/',","143":" \/\/'upload_url' => $this->get_full_url().'\/thumb\/',","144":" \/\/ Uncomment the following to force the max","145":" \/\/ dimensions and e.g. create square thumbnails:","146":" \/\/'crop' => true,","147":" 'max_width' => 80,","148":" 'max_height' => 80","149":" )","150":" ),","151":" 'print_response' => true","152":" );","153":" if ($options) {","154":" $this->options = $options + $this->options;","155":" }","156":" if ($error_messages) {","157":" $this->error_messages = $error_messages + $this->error_messages;","158":" }","159":" if ($initialize) {","160":" $this->initialize();","161":" }"}},{"severity":1,"category":"Cross Site The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following snippet:\r\n\t<%=request.getParameter(\"q\")%>.\r\n\r\nThe attacker could exploit this vulnerability by directing a victim to visit a URL\r\nwith specially crafted JavaScript to perform actions on the site on behalf of the\r\nattacker, or to simply steal the session cookie.\r\n\r\nA Attack","http:\/\/www.ibm.com\/developerworks\/tivoli\/library\/s-csscript\/":"IBM: Cross-site scripting"},"description":"Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities can be exploited by an attacker to\r\nimpersonate or perform actions on behalf of legitimate users.\r\n\r\nThis particular issue is caused by writing user-controlled data directly to the page.\r\nFor instance, consider the following Injection","http:\/\/en.wikipedia.org\/wiki\/SQL_injection":"Wikipedia: SQL Injection"},"description":"SQL injection is a code injection technique that exploits a security vulnerability\r\noccurring in the database layer of an application. The vulnerability is present when\r\nuser input is either incorrectly filtered for string literal escape characters\r\nembedded in SQL statements or user input is not strongly typed and thereby unexpectedly\r\nexecuted. It is an instance of a more general class of vulnerabilities that can occur\r\nwhenever one programming or scripting language is embedded inside another. Time","pluginName":"BuiltIn","description":"Do not use local time values for comparison to each other, long term storage (database),\r\nor cache expirations. Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for throttling or caching, this creates an opportunity for denial of service events","references":{"https:\/\/cwe.mitre.org\/data\/definitions\/613.html":"CWE-613: Insufficient Session local time values for comparison to each other, long term storage (database),\r\nor cache expirations. Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for local time values for comparison to each other, long term storage (database),\r\nor cache expirations. Instead, use UTC time or an _offset() variant for your platform.\r\n\r\nFrom PHP:\r\n\tIt is not safe to rely on the system's timezone settings. You are *required* to use the\r\n\tdate.timezone setting or the date_default_timezone_set() function. In case you used any of\r\n\tthose methods and you are still getting this warning, you most likely misspelled the timezone identifier.\r\n\tWe selected the timezone 'UTC' for now, but please set date.timezone to select your timezone.\r\n\r\n\r\nTimezone changes on the server or daylight saving time events cause incorrect comparisons between times.\r\nThis is a larger threat than the system UTC time changing for Windows applications because changing the\r\ntime in Windows requires Administrative privileges, whereas changing the timezone does not.\r\n\r\nIf local time is merely displayed to the user, unexpected changes may only annoy users.\r\nIf local time is used for session or credential expiration, this creates an opportunity for other attacks.\r\nIf local time is used for
